label: AB2_hP6_194_c_f-001
title: Molybdenite (MoS$_{2}$, $C7$) Structure
comments:
MoS$_{2}$ exists naturally in two forms: a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hR3_160_a_2a-001}{rhombohedral structure} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP6_194_c_f-001}{this hexagonal structure, molybdenite, {\em Strukturbericht} $C7$}. The two structures differ due to the stacking of the MoS$_{2}$ layers. 
 Depending on the preparation method, MoS$_{2}$ can exist in other forms, including a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP12_143_ad_bc2d-001}{trigonal structure}. 
 Note that the stacking here is B\textbf{A}BA\textbf{B}A, where the layers in bold text are the Mo atoms.
